formattedAddress: 399 Grand St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 399 Grand St, New York, NY 10002, USA

editorialSummary.text: Brick-oven pizzas, sandwiches & pastas, plus coffee & a full bar, in a casual, old-world atmosphere.

originalText.text: This place was recommended to me and boy was happy I didn't wait long. Had the baked ziti and cheese fries. Food tasted amazing and very well portioned. The presentation was very good as you can see by the photos. The atmosphere was very good as the staff served me fast and very friendly. They have a wide variety of liquor and beer to go with amazing food.

originalText.text:
This sports bar has the most amazing food. We order a few of the appetizers and a couple of salads.
It was very tasty, but the stand out for me was the salad de capris. That was amazing!!!
The waiter was really cool as well. I would definitely come back to this establishment....when there isn't a championship fight happening.

originalText.text:
Very disorganized. Once you enter the restaurant no one is there to greet you or sit you.  A table server came after sitting a couple in a 4 seater table and told us we were next once a table opens and told us to wait at the bar.  Meanwhile I noticed there were more table servers going up to people coming into the restaurant and telling them they were next for a table . The servers were not communicating with each other. Our original server came and reassured us we were next once table was cleaned.  We sat down at the bar and waited. The table was cleaned and we sat down.  Another table server came out of no where and told us this wasn't our table he promised other people that just came in the table.  We told him we were promised the next table by another server and to please call him over to discuss it with him.  He did not want to hear it.  He told us to get up and we had to wait for another table that could sit 2. Meanwhile there were no 2 seaters. There  were 4 seater tables and 2 people were sitting. We pointed that out to him but again he did not want to here it.  We asked him how long we had to wait he said maybe 5 mins or more he said he couldn't say.  He became angry at us and very rude! We again tried to tell him to get our original server. He told us he was the head honcho of the place and told us he will not allow anyone to serve us if we stayed sitting at the table the other waiter promised. We had no choice but to leave the establishment.
What ever happened to admitting there was a misunderstanding and apologizing and rectifying the problem so it never happens again instead of losing customers.  It's true losing 2 customers so  you can make more tips or money from 4 is a good business sense.  But good hospitality goes a long way!! . Very very disappointed in the way we were treated by the head honcho.

originalText.text: Coming from Chicago it‚Äôs hard to try pizza anywhere but home! The NY Chicago pizza feud may never end but Saluggis definitely sets the bar for NY pizza! Had to download the one bite app and try the best pizza around where we were staying! All I can say is the pizza here makes my mouth water as I‚Äôm writing this review! We kept it simple with a bottle of wine and a red pizza! The softness coupled with the surprisingly crisp crust was a perfect pair. The roasted beet salad was a perfect started too! Small little restaurant with a home feeling and perfect friendly service! Who said NY people were mean? Not here!
